lines.line: Hello. My name is Dimintheis, of the noble family Fitzharmon.
Why would a nobleman live in a dump like this?
The King has taken my estate from me until such time as I can show my family crest to him.
Why would he do that?

Well, there is a long standing rule of chivalry amongst the Varrockian aristocracy, where each noble family is in possession of a unique crest, which signifies the honour and lineage of the family. More than this

however, it also represents the lawful rights of each family to prove their ownership of their wealth and lands. If the family crest is lost, then the family's estate is handed over to the current monarch until the crest is
restored.

This dates back to the times when there was much in- fighting amongst the noble families and their clans, and was introduced as a way of reducing the bloodshed that was devestating the ranks of the ruling classes at that
time. When you captured a rival family's clan, you also captured their lands and wealth.
So where is this crest?
Well, my three sons took it with them many years ago when they rode out to fight in the war against the undead necromancer and his army in the battle to save Varrock.

For many years I had assumed them all dead, as I had heard no word from them, but recently I heard word that my son Caleb is alive and well, and trying to earn his fortune as a great chef in the lands beyond White
Wolf Mountain, although I know not where.
Ok, I will help you.
I thank you greatly adventurer! Also... if you find Caleb... please... let him know his father still loves him...
I'm not interested in that adventure right now.
I realise it was a lot to ask of a stranger.
You're rich then? Can I have some money?
Gah! Lousy Beggar! Your sort is what's ruining this great land! Why don't you just go and get a job if you need the money so badly?
Hi, I am a bold adventurer.
An adventurer hmmm? How lucky. I may have an adventure for you. I desperately need my family crest returning to me. It is of utmost importance.
Why are you so desperate for it?
Where did you say I could find your son Caleb again?
The only thing I have heard of my son Caleb is that he is trying to earn his fortune as a great chef in the lands beyond White Wolf Mountain.
Have you any news on my crest yet?
I'm still looking for it.
Who are you? What are you after?
Are you Caleb Fitzharmon?
Why... yes I am, but I don't believe I know you... how did you know my name?
I have been sent by your father. He wishes the Fitzharmon Crest be restored.
Ah... well... hmmm... yes... I do have a piece of it anyway...
Uh... what happened to the rest of it?
Well... my brothers and I had a slight disagreement about it... we all wanted to be heir to my fathers' lands, and we each ended up with a piece of the crest.
None of us wanted to give up our rights to our brothers, so we didn't want to give up our pieces of the crest, but none of us wanted to face our father by
returning to him with an incomplete crest... We each went our seperate ways many years past, none of us seeing our father or willing to give up our fragments.
So do you know where I could find any of your brothers?
Well, we haven't really kept in touch... what with the dispute over the crest and all... I did hear from my brother Avan a while ago though.
He said he was on some kind of search for treasure, or gold, or something out in the desert east of Lumbridge. You might want to ask the traders there about him.
Avan always did have expensive tastes however. You may find he is not prepared to hand over his crest piece to you as easily as I have.
So can I have your bit?
Well, I am the oldest son, so by the rules of chivalry, I am most entitled to be rightful bearer of the crest.
It's not really much use without the other fragments is it though?
Well that is true... perhaps it is time to put my pride aside... I'll tell you what: I'm struggling to complete this fish salad of mine,
so if you will assist me in my search for the ingredients, then I will let you take my piece as reward for your assistance.
So what ingredients are you missing?
I require the following cooked fish: Swordfish, Bass, Tuna, Salmon and Shrimp.
Ok, I will get those.
You will? It would help me a lot!
Why don't you just give me the crest?
It's a valuable family heirloom. I think the least you can do is prove you're worthy of it before I hand it over.
Nothing, I will be on my way.
I see you are a chef, will you cook me anything?
I would, but I am very busy. I am trying to increase my reknown as one of the world's leading chefs by preparing a special and unique fish salad.
How is the fish collecting going?
I didn't manage to get them all yet...
Remember, I want the following cooked fish: Swordfish, Bass, Tuna, Salmon, and Shrimp.
Got them all with me.
Thank you very much.
You're welcome.
Where did you say I could find Avan again?
Last I heard he was on some stupid hunt for gold or treasure, somewhere in the desert east of Lumbridge. You might want to ask the traders there about him.
How are you doing getting the crest pieces?
I am still working on it.
Then why are you wasting your time here?
I have lost the piece you gave me...
I have some good news for you then. One of my customers found this on their travels and recognised it as mine and returned it to me here.
I suggest you be less careless in the future. The crest is extremely valuable, and utterly irreplaceable.
Hello again. I'm just putting the finishing touches to my masterful salad.
Good luck with that then.
Luck? LUCK? With my cooking skill, I don't really need LUCK.
I've got it right here!
Excellent work! Please take it to my father immediately.
Do you want to buy any fine silks?
I'm in search of a man named Avan Fitzharmon.
Can't say as I've seen him... I'm sure if he's been to Al Kharid recently someone around here will have though.
A thousand greetings, sir.
Can't say as I've seen him... I'm sure if he's been to Al Kharid recently someone around here will have though.
Would you like to buy a nice kebab? Only one gold.
Can't say as I've seen him... I'm sure if he's been to Al Kharid recently someone around here will have though.
Can I help you at all?
Can't say as I've seen him... I'm sure if he's been to Al Kharid recently someone around here will have though.
Hey, wanna buy some armour?
Can't say as I've seen him... I'm sure if he's been to Al Kharid recently someone around here will have though.
Do you want to buy any armoured skirts? Designed especially for ladies who like to fight.
Can't say as I've seen him... I'm sure if he's been to Al Kharid recently someone around here will have though.
What? Can't you see I'm busy?
Well, sooooorry...
Good day to you traveller. Would you be interested in buying some gems?
Fitzharmon eh? Hmmm.... If I'm not mistaken that's the family name of a member of the Varrockian nobility. You know, I HAVE seen someone of that
persuasion around here recently... Wearing a poncey yellow cape he was! Came in here all la-di-dah, high and mighty, asking for jewelry made
from 'perfect gold' - whatever that is - like 'normal' golds just not good enough for little lord fancy pants there! I told him to head to the desert
'Cos I know theres gold out there, in them there sand dunes... and if it's not up to his lordships high standards of 'gold perfection'...
Maybe we'll all get lucky and the scorpions will deal with him.
Why are you lurking around a scorpion pit?
It's a good place to find gold...
I'm looking for a man... his name is Avan Fitzharmon.
Then you have found him. My name is Avan Fitzharmon.
You have a part of your family crest. I am on a quest to retrieve all of the fragmented pieces and restore the crest.
Ha! I suppose one of my worthless brothers has sent you on this quest then?
No, it was your father who has asked me to do this for him.
My... my father wishes this? Then that is a different matter. I will let you have my crest shard, adventurer, but you must first do something for me.
There is a certain lady I am trying to impress. As a man of noble birth, I can not give her just any old trinket to show my devotion. What I intend to give her,
is a golden ring, embedded with the finest precious red stone available, and a necklace to match this ring. The problem however for me, is that
not just any old gold will be suitable. I seek only the purest, the most high quality of gold - what I seek, if you will, is perfect gold.
None of the gold around here is even remotely suitable in terms of quality. I have searched far and wide for the perfect gold I desire, but have had no success so
in finding it I am afraid. If you can find me my perfect gold, make a ring and necklace from it, and add rubies to them, I will
gladly hand over my fragment of the family crest to you.
Can you give me any help on finding this 'perfect gold'?
I thought I had found a solid lead on its whereabouts when I heard of a dwarf who is an expert on gold who goes by the name of 'Boot'.
Unfortunately he has apparently returned to his home, somewhere in the mountains, and I have no idea how to find him.
Well, I'll see what I can do.
So how are you doing getting me my perfect gold jewelry ?
I'm still after that 'perfect gold'.
I know how you feel... for such a long time I have searched and searched for the elusive perfect gold... I thought I had gotten a good lead on finding it
when I heard talk of a dwarven expert on gold named Boot some time back, but unfortunately for me, he has returned to his mountain home, which I cannot find.
Hello tall person.
Hello. I'm in search of very high quality gold.
High quality gold eh? Hmmm... Well, the very best quality gold that I know of, is just East of the large city Ardougne, underground somewhere.
I don't believe it's exactly easy to get to though...
Hello short person.
Why are you called boot?
I'm called Boot, because when I was very young, I used to sleep, in a large boot.
Yeah, great, I didn't want your life story.
So how are you doing making me my perfect gold jewelry ?
I have spoken to Boot the dwarf about the location of 'perfect gold' but haven't managed to make you your jewelry yet.
Well, I won't entrust you with my piece of the crest until you have brought me a necklace of perfect gold with a red precious stone, and a perfect gold ring to match.
I have the ring and necklace right here.
These... these are exquisite! EXACTLY what I was searching for all of this time! Please, take my crest fragment!
Now, I suppose you will be wanting to find my brother Johnathon who is in possession of the final piece of the family's crest?
That's correct.
Well, the last I heard of my brother Johnathon, he was studying the magical arts, and trying to hunt some demon or other out in The Wilderness.
Unsurprisingly, I do not believe he is doing a particularly good job of things, and spends most of his time recovering from his injuries in
some tavern or other near the edge of The Wilderness. You'll probably find him still there.
Thanks Avan.
Where did you say I could find your brother Johnathon again?
Greetings again, adventurer. How are you doing on retrieving the crest pieces?
I hope you succeed for my father's sake.
I have lost the fragment you gave me...
I have a confession myself adventurer... I did not fully trust you with the actual part of my family's crest before, and gave you a worthless replica before...
In hindsight, it seems I was right. I will give you the real piece now, but PLEASE try not to lose it; it is a priceless family heirloom.
I have assembled all of the pieces!
Very well done adventurer! Now please return it to my father!
Greetings. Would you happen to be Johnathon Fitzharmon?
That... I am...
I am here to retrieve your fragment of the Fitzharmon family crest.
The.. poison.. it is all.. too much... My head... will not... stop spinning...
What... what did that spider... DO to me? I... I feel so weak... I can hardly... think at all...
Ooooh... thank you... Wow! That's completely cured me!
How can I reward you?
I've come here for your piece of the Fitzharmon family crest.
You have? Unfortunately I don't have it any more... in my attempts to slay the fiendish Chronozon, the blood demon, I lost a lot of equipment in
our last battle when he bested me and forced me away from his den. He probably still has it now.
So is this Chronozon hard to defeat?
Well... you will have to be a skilled Mage to defeat him, and my powers are not good enough yet. You will need to hit him once with each of the four elemental spells of death
before he will be defeated.
Where can I find Chronozon?
The fiend has made his lair in the Wilderness below the Obelisk of Air.
So how did you end up getting poisoned?
Those accursed poison spiders that surround the entrance to Chronozon's lair... I must have taken a nip from one of them as I attempted to make my escape.
I will be on my way now.
My thanks for the assistance adventurer.
I'm trying to kill this demon Chronozon that you mentioned...
Wish me luck.
Good luck. You'll need it.
I have your piece of the crest!
Well done! Now return it to my father!
I have retrieved your crest.
Adventurer... I can only thank you for your kindness, although the words are insufficient to express the gratitude I feel!
You are truly a hero in every sense, and perhaps your efforts can begin to patch the wounds that have torn this family apart...

I know not how I can adequately reward you for your efforts... although I do have these mystical gauntlets, a family heirloom that through some power unknown to me, have always returned to the head of the family
whenever lost, or if the owner has died. I will pledge these to you, and if you should lose them return to me, and they will be here.
They can also be granted extra powers. Take them to one of my sons, they should be able to imbue them with a skill for you.
I hear you brought the completed crest to my father. I must say, that was awfully impressive work.
I believe your father mentioned you would be able to improve these gauntlets for me...
Yes, that is correct. I can slightly alter these gauntlets to allow you some of my skill at preparing seafood by making them cooking gauntlets.
When you wear them you will burn lobsters, sharks and swordfish a lot less. It will be a permanent modification however, so make sure this is what you want.
Yes, please do that for me.
I'll see what your brothers have to offer first.
As you wish. Let me know if you change your mind.
I have received word from my father of your assistance to our family in this matter. You have my thanks for restoring our honour.
Your father mentioned that you could improve these gauntlets in some way for me...
Indeed I can. In my long time searching for the 'perfect' gold I learned a lot about gold items. I can improve these gauntlets so that they provide more than normal
experience when smithing gold. I can easily modify these for you.
That sounds good, improve them for me!
I think I'll check my other options with your brothers before committing myself.
If you feel you really must consort with the likes of them. I await your decision.
Hello again. My family now considers you a hero.
Your father tells me you can improve these gauntlets for me...
And right he is at that. Although my skill with Death Rune magiks was not great enough to defeat Chronozon, I am adequately skilled at Chaos Rune magiks.
If you give me your gauntlets I will bestow upon them some of my power, and make any bolt spells you wish to cast more effective.
That sounds good to me!
I doubt they will offer anything as useful as my magical boost, but as you wish.

characters.name: Avan
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, refined and slightly haughty tone, a vain nobleman with expensive tastes who values perfection and luxury above all else.

characters.name: Boot
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, gruff Scottish accent, irritable and cantankerous tone, a short-tempered mining expert who enjoys telling stories about his past.

characters.name: Caleb
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, proud and professional tone, the eldest Fitzharmon son who takes great pride in his culinary skills and family birthright.

characters.name: Dimintheis
characters.description: Elderly male, refined British accent, dignified yet desperate tone, a fallen nobleman clinging to his aristocratic manners while living in reduced circumstances.

characters.name: Gem trader
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, animated and gossipy tone, a practical merchant who enjoys sharing local rumors and has little patience for pretentious nobility.

characters.name: Johnathon
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, weak and strained tone when poisoned but scholarly when healthy, a magic-studying nobleman who hunts demons despite lacking sufficient skill.

characters.name: Karim
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, warm and inviting tone, a friendly kebab seller who takes pride in his simple but satisfying food.

characters.name: Louie Legs
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, confident and professional tone, a specialized armor merchant proud of his selection of quality legwear.

characters.name: Man
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, refined and slightly haughty tone, a vain nobleman with expensive tastes who values perfection and luxury above all else.

characters.name: Ranael
characters.description: Middle-aged female, Middle Eastern accent, confident and businesslike tone, a knowledgeable shopkeeper who is an expert on armored skirts.

characters.name: Shop keeper
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, practical and businesslike tone, a commerce-focused general store owner who keeps transactions efficient.

characters.name: Silk trader
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, refined and courteous tone, a well-dressed merchant open to negotiation who sells fine silks.

characters.name: Zeke
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, animated and slightly sardonic tone, an enthusiastic scimitar merchant with a casual speaking style.
